tasks.task: Feeding livestock during winter in Wyoming.
subtasks: Determine if livestock need additional energy due to cold temperatures.
Monitor windchill temperature and adjust energy requirements accordingly.
Provide hay as additional forage to meet energy needs.
Store harvested alfalfa, oats, and grass bales for feeding during winter.
Assess body condition of cattle, sheep, etc., during winter.
Look for signs of stress in livestock due to cold temperatures and deep snow.
Consider deceptively calm winter weather as potentially stressful for livestock.

tasks.task: Understanding the relationship between temperature and livestock energy needs.
subtasks: Learn the minimum temperature livestock can tolerate without additional energy.
Calculate the increase in energy needed when windchill temperatures drop.
Adjust feeding practices based on temperature and windchill factors.

tasks.task: Feeding livestock during winter in Wyoming.
subtasks: Determine if livestock need additional energy based on temperature and windchill.
Store harvested forage (hay) for winter feeding.
Distribute hay to livestock.
Provide shelter or windbreaks during windy and snowy conditions.
Assess conditions (temperature, snow depth) to determine if feeding is needed.
Store and manage harvested forage (hay) for winter use.
Adjust feeding schedule and amount as needed (increase when temps are below 20°F).
Check current temperature and windchill.
Determine amount of additional forage needed.
Distribute stored hay to livestock.
Monitor livestock for signs of distress.

tasks.task: Manage livestock feed during severe winter conditions.
subtasks: Assess the need for additional hay based on temperature and windchill.
Store and manage hay bales harvested in summer and fall.
Distribute hay to livestock.
Provide shelter or barriers from wind and cold (if needed).
Monitor temperatures and windchill.
Calculate additional hay needed based on cold conditions.
Store and manage hay harvested in summer and fall.
Distribute hay to livestock.
Check body condition and health of livestock during winter.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Feeding livestock during winter in Wyoming.
subtasks: Determine if livestock need additional energy due to temperatures and windchill.
Monitor windchill temperature and adjust energy requirements accordingly.
Provide hay as additional forage to meet energy needs.

Assess body condition of cattle, sheep, etc., during winter.
